title: Court Rules Trump Can't Fire Fed Governor Cook, Cites Due Process Rights
snippets: A federal appeals court blocked President Trump from firing Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook, just ahead of a key vote on interest rates.
Cook's claim that she was denied due process has a 'strong likelihood of success', court rules
Appeals court rules Fed governor Cook can continue to serve
The ruling comes on the same day the Senate voted along party lines to approve Trump‚Äôs economic adviser Stephen Miran‚Äôs nomination for the Federal Reserve board.
In a 2-1 decision, the appeals court found that Cook's due process rights were violated because the administration did not give her a formal opportunity to respond to the charges.
titles: Appeals court says Lisa Cook can stay on the Federal Reserve board -- for now
US appeals court blocks Trump‚Äôs bid to fire Lisa Cook from Federal Reserve
Appeals court rules Fed governor Cook can continue to serve - Axios
Federal Appeals Court Blocks Trump‚Äôs Bid To Fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook Ahead Of Rate Cut Meeting
Appeals court rejects Trump‚Äôs bid to oust Lisa Cook from the Fed ahead of crucial interest rate decision
summary: A federal appeals court ruled that President Trump cannot fire Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook, citing a 'strong likelihood of success' for Cook's due process claim. The court's 2-1 decision highlighted that Cook was not given a formal chance to respond to charges, violating her due process rights. This ruling came as the Senate approved Trump‚Äôs nominee Stephen Miran for the Federal Reserve board. Cook can continue to serve on the Federal Reserve.

title: Trump Sues NY Times for $15B, Alleging Defamation in Epstein Note Coverage
snippets: He has accused the paper of defamation and libel, saying it served as a "mouthpiece" for Democrats.
The US president has filed a multi-billion dollar lawsuit against the paper. The filing comes a week after it published a suggestive note that Trump allegedly wrote to Jeffrey Epstein.
Trump has initiated a flurry of defamation lawsuits against media companies, accusing them of false or misleading coverage.
US president accuses media organisation of being ‚Äòmouthpiece‚Äô for Democratic party

US president announces defamation and libel action in Florida, accusing title of being ‚Äòvirtual mouthpiece‚Äô for Democrats

Donald Trump has filed a $15bn defamation lawsuit against the New York Times and four of its journalists.

The lawsuit, filed in a US district court in Florida on M
Trump said he is filing a $15 billion defamation and libel lawsuit against The Times in Florida.
titles: Trump says he will sue New York Times for $15bn
Trump sues The New York Times for defamation
Trump sues The New York Times for $15 billion, alleging defamation and libel
Trump files $15bn defamation lawsuit against New York Times
Donald Trump says he is bringing $15bn lawsuit against New York Times
Trump says he is bringing a $15 billion lawsuit against The New York Times
summary: Donald Trump has filed a $15 billion defamation and libel lawsuit against The New York Times and four of its journalists in Florida, accusing the newspaper of being a "mouthpiece" for the Democratic party. This legal action follows a recent publication by the newspaper of a note Trump allegedly wrote to Jeffrey Epstein, which Trump claims is false. This lawsuit is part of Trump's broader campaign of litigation against media organizations over their coverage.

title: Phillies Clinch NL East Title Again with 6-5 Win Over Dodgers
snippets: Kyle Schwarber, Weston Wilson and Bryce Harper homered, and the Phillies wrapped up their second straight National League East title with a thrilling 6-5 victory over the Dodgers on Monday night.
The Phillies pulled away from the Mets in September
The Philadelphia Phillies have officially clinched the NL East after a close victory against the Los Angeles Dodgers.

J.T. Realmuto drove in the go-ahead run on a sacrifice fly in the 10th inning, capping a wild 6-5 comeback victory by the Philadelphia Phillies over the Los Angeles Dodgers that clinched the NL East title in the series opener between division leaders.
titles: Phillies clinch NL East with wild win vs. Dodgers
Phillies win NL East for second straight season, beat Dodgers in extras in clinching victory
Phillies clinch NL East after extra-inning win
Phillies clinch NL East title in wild 10th-inning comeback against Dodgers
summary: The Philadelphia Phillies clinched their second consecutive National League East title with a 6-5 win over the Los Angeles Dodgers, highlighted by home runs from Kyle Schwarber, Weston Wilson, and Bryce Harper. The victory, secured by J.T. Realmuto's go-ahead sacrifice fly in the 10th inning, marked a significant comeback in the series opener between the division leaders. This win also solidified the Phillies' position ahead of the Mets in September.

summary: President Donald Trump signed an executive order to deploy National Guard troops to Memphis, citing high crime rates. This action is part of his administration's broader strategy to address urban crime in Democratic-run cities. Memphis Mayor Paul Young, a Democrat, acknowledged the decision but expressed doubts about its effectiveness in reducing crime. Critics of the move view it as an example of Trump's authoritarian approach.

title: US, China Near TikTok Deal, Trump and Xi to Finalize Soon
snippets: US President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping could finalize the deal on the Chinese-owned video platform TikTok in the coming days.
Trump suggests TikTok deal, will talk to China's Xi on Friday
The U.S. and China have a 'framework' deal for social media platform TikTok in place, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Monday.
Top economic officials met in Madrid for a second day, with deadlines looming on tariffs and a ban on TikTok in the United States if it is not sold by its Chinese owner, ByteDance.

The "framework" deal with China is
"between two private parties, but the commercial terms have been agreed upon," CNBC quoted Bessent as saying on the sidelines of a meeting between the two countries in Madrid on Monday.
titles: US reaches 'framework' TikTok deal with China, Trump and Xi to speak
Trump suggests TikTok deal, will talk to China's Xi on Friday - Axios

U.S. and China Reach ‚ÄòFramework‚Äô for a TikTok Sale
US, China reach ‚Äòframework‚Äô deal for TikTok
summary: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping are nearing a deal on TikTok, as announced by Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. They have established a 'framework' agreement aimed at resolving the long-standing dispute over the video platform's ownership due to security concerns. Bessent, speaking from Madrid, noted the progress during trade talks with China. Trump also mentioned that discussions have been successful and anticipates a call with Xi Jinping within the week to finalize the agreement.

title: Tom Brady to Play in Flag Football Event in Riyadh with NFL Stars
snippets: The seven-time Super Bowl champ is getting back on the football field next year

Tom Brady plans to play alongside current and former NFL stars in a three-team flag football tournament in Saudi Arabia next year, the seven-time Super Bowl-winning quarterback said on Monday.

summary: Tom Brady announced his participation in "The Fanatics Flag Football Classic," a three-team flag football tournament in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, scheduled for March 21. The event, in collaboration with Fanatics, Fox Sports, and OBB Media, will feature Brady playing alongside current and former NFL stars, including retired Patriots player Rob Gronkowski. Brady referred to his involvement as "coming out of retirement" for this occasion.

title: US Strikes Drug Cartel Vessel, 3 Dead; Trump Signals More Actions Ahead
snippets: President Trump said the U.S. military on Monday again targeted a boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela, killing three aboard the vessel.
The strike comes two weeks after the US targeted what the Trump administration said was a drug vessel from Venezuela. The Venezuelan president has vowed to defend against Washington's "aggression."
The president also signaled that his administration was preparing to take military action against Latin American cartels that move narcotics over land.

Nearly two weeks after a deadly U.S. strike on a boat in the Caribbean, questions loom over Trump‚Äôs new war on terror and drugs. This afternoon, Trump announced another strike on a boat from Venezuela.
titles: Trump says the U.S. military targeted a boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela

summary: The US conducted a strike against a vessel in international waters, which President Trump described as targeting "extraordinarily violent drug trafficking cartels" bound for the US. This action follows a recent operation against a drug vessel from Venezuela and comes amidst tensions with Venezuelan President Maduro, who has promised to defend against US "aggression." The strike resulted in the deaths of three individuals. Additionally, President Trump has indicated plans for further military actions against Latin American cartels involved in narcotics trafficking.
